title: How to Make a Twelfth Night Cake

steps.headline: Grease and line a 25cm/10in cake tin with buttered greaseproof paper.
Cream the butter and sugar together until light and fluffy.
Whisk the eggs with brandy/rum and beat gradually into the creamed mixture.
Sift the flour and spices and add a little at a time to the mixture.
Add the fruit and nuts (plus the pea and bean) and mix thoroughly.
Put the mixture into the cake tin, smooth the top and make a slight hollow in the centre.
Bake for 3-3.5 hours.
steps.description: If the top of the cake looks like it is getting too brown, then cover with a sheet of greaseproof paper. The cake is cooked when a skewer inserted into the middle come out clean.

steps.headline: Leave to cool in the tin for 15 minutes and then complete cooling on a wire rack.
Serve the cake wrapped into a paper gold crown (to represent the three kings).
steps.description: Don't forget to warn your guests about the pea and bean!

text: Pre-heat the oven to 150 °C (302 °F).  Grease and line a 25cm/10in cake tin with buttered greaseproof paper.  Cream the butter and sugar together until light and fluffy.  Whisk the eggs with brandy/rum and beat gradually into the creamed mixture.  Sift the flour and spices and add a little at a time to the mixture.  Add the fruit and nuts (plus the pea and bean) and mix thoroughly.  Put the mixture into the cake tin, smooth the top and make a slight hollow in the centre.  Bake for 3-3.5 hours. If the top of the cake looks like it is getting too brown, then cover with a sheet of greaseproof paper. The cake is cooked when a skewer inserted into the middle come out clean. Leave to cool in the tin for 15 minutes and then complete cooling on a wire rack.  Serve the cake wrapped into a paper gold crown (to represent the three kings). Don't forget to warn your guests about the pea and bean!
